Ready to take the plunge and launch your own halal online business?

Do your research, invest in professional branding, and always put customer satisfaction first. 

With focus and dedication, you can turn your passion into a thriving venture!

#ummahpreneur #enterpreneur #muslimahentrepreneur

Drop your favorite quote by a successful entrepreneur in the comments below!

Success is not a destination, it's a journey. And to succeed, you need to have the right mindset, determination, and perseverance.

Unlocking the secrets to success takes time, effort, and patience, but it's worth every step of the way. It's about discovering your strengths, improving your weaknesses, and taking action towards your goals.

Believe in yourself and trust the process, and you'll be surprised at what you can achieve.

Remember, success is not just about material possessions or social status. It's about personal growth, happiness, and fulfillment. It's about being the best version of yourself and making a positive impact on the world.

#ummahpreneur #muslimahentrepreneur #enterprenuership #enterpreneur

We are so back!!!

We know it‚Äôs been quiet around here. You‚Äôll all be really happy to know Abby who used to lead Ummahpreneur had a baby alhamdulillah and has been really busy in his personal life and unable to dedicate the time needed to keep this community going.

With this, we wanted to make sure this beautiful mission of nurturing muslim entrepreneurship continued, especially with the way things are going now around the world.

So Abby and I discussed it, and we made the thoughtful decision that I will be taking over and continuing the amazing work we started!

Hi, I‚Äôm Youssef, and I‚Äôve been part of the Ummahpreneur team since day 1!

If you‚Äôve ever signed up to our courses or community, you‚Äôll recognize me as the social media director and the course instructor for all social media and marketing training at Ummahpreneur.

Now, I couldn‚Äôt be more excited to revive this platform and serve the amazing people here in new and exciting ways.

Here‚Äôs what you can expect.
‚û°Ô∏è Valuable content to inspire and support Muslim entrepreneurs
‚û°Ô∏è Resources to help you start your business or take it to the next level
‚û°Ô∏è New services tailored exactly for your needs

Now tell me in the comments! What would YOU like to see from this space?

That‚Äôs the essence of zuhd: not letting the dunya chain your heart. He slept on a straw mat, mended his own clothes, and never let possessions define him.

In a world obsessed with showing off, remember ‚Äî this life is only a stop, not the destination.

People love saying,
‚ÄúIf you want success, take the stairs‚Äù

That part is true.

But here‚Äôs what most people get wrong.

Taking the stairs doesn‚Äôt mean
you have to start from zero.

Let us explain.

When we first started learning things like
filming,
editing,
personal branding,
building a coaching business‚Ä¶

we had no one to show us how.

No roadmap.
No guidance.
No shortcuts.

So we learned the hard way.
Trial and error.
Mistake after mistake.

That‚Äôs why it took years.

Not because effort was the problem.
But because direction was missing.

And this is where people confuse things.

You still have to put in the work.
No one is taking that away from you.

But you don‚Äôt need to spend five years
figuring out what already works.

That‚Äôs the role of a coach.

At GrowRizq, our job isn‚Äôt to remove effort.
It‚Äôs to remove confusion.

We simplify the roadmap.
We show you the sequence.
We help you avoid mistakes we already made.

You still climb the stairs.
But you‚Äôre not wandering in the dark.

That‚Äôs how progress actually speeds up.

Not by skipping work.
But by knowing where to place it.

And once you learn that,
you don‚Äôt just build for yourself.

You pass that clarity on to your own clients.

That‚Äôs the real leverage.

Everyone talks about the ‚Äúgrowth zone‚Äù.

Very few people tell you what actually sits between you and it.

Let us explain.

You don‚Äôt jump from comfort straight to growth.
That‚Äôs not how it works in real life.

The first stop is fear.

Fear of looking stupid.
Fear of getting it wrong.
Fear of wasting time.
Fear of being judged.

Most people feel that fear and turn back.
They call it ‚Äúbeing realistic‚Äù.
It‚Äôs not.
It‚Äôs staying comfortable.

Here‚Äôs the truth we‚Äôve seen over and over again at GrowRizq:

Growth doesn‚Äôt start with confidence.
It starts with learning.

Learning what works.
Learning what doesn‚Äôt.
Learning through repetition, mistakes, and feedback.

That learning phase feels slow.
Messy.
Uncertain.

And that‚Äôs exactly why it works.

Because every time you step through fear instead of avoiding it,
you earn clarity.
You earn skill.
You earn momentum.

Comfort feels safe.
But it doesn‚Äôt move you.

Fear feels uncomfortable.
But it points you forward.

Learning bridges the gap.
Growth is the outcome.

So if you‚Äôre feeling uneasy right now,
good.

You didn‚Äôt do something wrong.
You just left the comfort zone.

Stay there long enough to learn.
That‚Äôs how growth actually happens.

‚ÄúWhere Does the Soul Go After Death?‚Äù...

Death isn‚Äôt the end, it‚Äôs a change of worlds.
But not every soul enters the same place.

In the reel, the father speaks about the merciful side of the unseen world, the place of peace, safety, and divine comfort.
But Islam teaches something deeper:
souls separate into different destinations depending on the life they lived, the choices they made, and the state of their hearts.

For the righteous, the transition is gentle, like falling asleep in Allah‚Äôs mercy.
For others, the journey is different.
Death reflects who we became.

This conversation focuses on the beauty prepared for those who lived with faith, sincerity, and goodness.
But it‚Äôs also a reminder:
Every decision shapes where your soul wakes up next.

Live with intention.
Live with faith.
Because the soul always returns to the One who gave it.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz

If Allah Already Knows‚Ä¶ Do Your Choices Still Matter?

If everything is written, why choose at all?
Because knowing a path isn‚Äôt the same as forcing it.

You didn‚Äôt choose where you started.
But every step after that is yours.

Fate sets the stage.
Free will writes the story.

And Allah doesn‚Äôt judge what you were given;
He judges what you chose to do with it.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz #freedom

The Self Is the Cage...

Freedom doesn‚Äôt come from finding yourself, it comes from losing the idea of who you think you are.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz

The First Lie We Were Told About Reality...

What if everything you believe about the world, even what it‚Äôs made of;
was built on a beautiful illusion?

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalthoughts #openmind #amrouz

Man is nothing else but what he makes of himself.

#inspirationalquotes #inspiration #lifelessons #amrouz

Sometimes the hardest truth is the one that frees you.

You‚Äôre not broken; you‚Äôve just been avoiding the choices that would change everything.

The moment you stop running from yourself is the moment life starts moving again.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz

#insightfulthoughts #inspiration #lifelessons #amrouz

Life is always better when kept hidden. 

People often have agendas and not everyone wants the best for you. 

This new world in which everyone shares the best moments of their lives is all fake. 

People are hurt inside, and most people show off themselves online to find some sort of validation.

Avoid the trap and stay discreet. 

Life is better that way. 

And at the end of the day. What you don‚Äôt share, can‚Äôt be destroyed.

This is how people think goals work.

You set a goal.
You work hard.
You achieve it.

Clean. Straight. Simple.

That‚Äôs the expectation.

Now let us explain the reality.

You start.
Then you doubt yourself.
Then you try to learn.
Then you mess it up.
Then you practice.
Then you fail.
Then you feel lost.
Then you get a small win.
Then you struggle again.

And only then do you achieve it.

This part right here...
the confusion, the setbacks, the frustration...

That‚Äôs not failure.
That is the process.

At GrowRizq, we see people quit in the middle all the time.
Not because they‚Äôre incapable.
But because no one told them this part was normal.

They thought something was wrong.
It wasn‚Äôt.

Progress doesn‚Äôt move in a straight line.
It loops.
It doubles back.
It tests you.

And the people who make it
aren‚Äôt the most talented.
They‚Äôre the ones who don‚Äôt panic
when reality doesn‚Äôt match the picture in their head.

So if things feel messy right now‚Ä¶
If you‚Äôre doubting yourself‚Ä¶
If it‚Äôs taking longer than you expected‚Ä¶

Good.

You‚Äôre not off track.
You‚Äôre on it.

Stay in the game.
Keep moving.
The line only looks straight once you‚Äôre on the other side.

"Why Do We Suffer?"....

Pain isn‚Äôt a punishment.
It‚Äôs a doorway.
Sometimes Allah uses storms
to grow the roots you never knew you had. üåßÔ∏è‚ú®

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz

Phones have slowly ruined our lives. 

We are the most connected generation on earth, yet are grossly disconnected from those in our immediate orbit. 

This is the trajectory the world is taking and it‚Äôs important that we remain sensitive to what these devices are doing to us. 

I‚Äôm massively guilty of this myself. 
So this reminder is for me first.

Life is short.
Death waits for nobody. 
And what we do on earth will ultimately determine where we end up once we die. 

None of us are guaranteed to see tomorrow. 

Recently a beloved brother of ours @healthy_mindset passed away tragically and we ask Allah to widen his grave and forgive his sins. 

This is a wake up call for us all that this life is transient and short. We‚Äôre all going to die, so prepare for that meeting with your lord.

I am 31, today I am in a position where I am blessed to wake up at whatever time I want and do whatever I want with whoever I want. 

That level of freedom is absolutely priceless. 

Once you taste it, going back to a normal life becomes difficult. 

The pursuit of wealth isn‚Äôt to simply ‚Äòhave money‚Äô but it is to use that money to bring you freedom. 

The freedom to say NO to opportunities that aren‚Äôt a priority, the freedom to live life on your terms and the freedom to build something of your own. 

My business @growrizq has freed me up to be independent and has allowed me to build my own projects. And I truly thank Allah for this. 

My advice to all those reading. 

Use wealth to amplify the impact you can have on others in this life.

Comment SYSTEM üëá

January exposes a hard truth most people don‚Äôt want to face.

Motivation fades.
Life gets busy.
And without structure and systems, nothing actually changes.

What systems do is that they remove the guesswork and allow you to show up even when you don‚Äôt feel like it.

That‚Äôs how consistency is built.
That‚Äôs how growth becomes predictable.
That‚Äôs how attention turns into income.

If you‚Äôre a coach, creator, or someone with real skills and experience,
but you‚Äôre stuck trying to figure out what to post, how to generate ideas, and how to build something sustainable online,
this is for you.

I‚Äôve broken everything down in a free training, step by step.

Comment SYSTEM and I‚Äôll send it over.

The new year a Time for Change

We reflect on the importance of personal transformation, spiritual growth, and returning to our faith as we enter a new year. We discuss the significance of learning about Prophet Muhammad‚Äôs character, understanding the Quran‚Äôs teachings, and becoming better Muslims by improving our relationships with family, community, and ultimately, with Allah.

#muslim #islam #viral #islam4everyone_ #newyear

This year, I went quiet.

Over the last 3 years i‚Äôve been traveling all over the world, from one event to another, from one stage to the next. But along the way, I realised something uncomfortable:
impact through events and social media is often anecdotal and shallow.

It looks powerful.
It feels productive.
But when the lights go off, very little actually remains.

So I decide to step away from everything...

I stopped traveling, doing tours, lectures and being in the public. And I finally chose to get my head down and poured myself into building something that wouldn‚Äôt disappear when the lights went off. 

In Ramadan 2025 there was just an idea, a vision and a sincere intention to make genuine, long lasting change. Many of you supported it before there was anything to show. 

And I can never express my true gratitude to all of you who believed in this. May Allah reward you all. 

Since then, structures have been built.
Teams have been formed.
Leaders have been gathered.
Systems have been put in place.

All for one reason:
to save the next generation from losing their faith. 

The foundations are now laid.
And the next phase is about scale.

2026 is all about solidifying everything. And then moving this vision forward. 
Supporting more leaders. 
Impacting more young people. 

And making sure this work never stops. 

If saving the next generations matters to you and if you want to help ensure it continues long after us‚Ä¶

Comment the word‚ÄúSAVE‚Äù to be part of this mission. 

Follow @criterion.group and stay with us as we take this forward.

The responsibility is now on our shoulders. 

Bismillah.

Men feel alive when we are building. 

We love progress, growth and moving forward. 

As a man you need a project, goal or something to work towards.

Because if you don‚Äôt, then you‚Äôre going to be pulled into different directions led by your lowly desires.
"To people who struggle with their faith and feel lost, Ipray that you find your peace and that you never feel lost again." AMEEN

Here‚Äôs what most people don‚Äôt understand about credibility.

It‚Äôs not something you claim.
It‚Äôs something you earn.

Let us explain.

The people who end up ‚Äúon top of their game‚Äù
aren‚Äôt the loudest.
They‚Äôre not the ones chasing attention.

They‚Äôre the ones who apply.

They show up.
They do the work.
They watch.
They ask questions.
They implement.
They stay consistent when no one‚Äôs clapping.

That‚Äôs what compounds.

Over time, something shifts.
People start noticing.
Not because you‚Äôre marketing harder,
but because your results speak for you.

And then it happens naturally.

People start asking:
‚ÄúHow did you do this?‚Äù
‚ÄúCan you show me?‚Äù
‚ÄúCan you help me?‚Äù

That‚Äôs when your offer actually makes sense.

Not because you‚Äôre trying to sell.
But because demand already exists.

At GrowRizq, this is the long game we teach.
Earn credibility first.
Build proof second.
Monetise last.

Skip that order,
and you end up convincing people.

Follow it,
and people come to you ready.

That‚Äôs how authority is built.
Quietly.
Consistently.
Over time.

People love saying,
‚ÄúIf you want success, take the stairs‚Äù

That part is true.

But here‚Äôs what most people get wrong.

Taking the stairs doesn‚Äôt mean
you have to start from zero.

Let us explain.

When we first started learning things like
filming,
editing,
personal branding,
building a coaching business‚Ä¶

we had no one to show us how.

No roadmap.
No guidance.
No shortcuts.

So we learned the hard way.
Trial and error.
Mistake after mistake.

That‚Äôs why it took years.

Not because effort was the problem.
But because direction was missing.

And this is where people confuse things.

You still have to put in the work.
No one is taking that away from you.

But you don‚Äôt need to spend five years
figuring out what already works.

That‚Äôs the role of a coach.

At GrowRizq, our job isn‚Äôt to remove effort.
It‚Äôs to remove confusion.

We simplify the roadmap.
We show you the sequence.
We help you avoid mistakes we already made.

You still climb the stairs.
But you‚Äôre not wandering in the dark.

That‚Äôs how progress actually speeds up.

Not by skipping work.
But by knowing where to place it.

And once you learn that,
you don‚Äôt just build for yourself.

You pass that clarity on to your own clients.

That‚Äôs the real leverage.

Everyone talks about the ‚Äúgrowth zone‚Äù.

Very few people tell you what actually sits between you and it.

Let us explain.

You don‚Äôt jump from comfort straight to growth.
That‚Äôs not how it works in real life.

The first stop is fear.

Fear of looking stupid.
Fear of getting it wrong.
Fear of wasting time.
Fear of being judged.

Most people feel that fear and turn back.
They call it ‚Äúbeing realistic‚Äù.
It‚Äôs not.
It‚Äôs staying comfortable.

Here‚Äôs the truth we‚Äôve seen over and over again at GrowRizq:

Growth doesn‚Äôt start with confidence.
It starts with learning.

Learning what works.
Learning what doesn‚Äôt.
Learning through repetition, mistakes, and feedback.

That learning phase feels slow.
Messy.
Uncertain.

And that‚Äôs exactly why it works.

Because every time you step through fear instead of avoiding it,
you earn clarity.
You earn skill.
You earn momentum.

Comfort feels safe.
But it doesn‚Äôt move you.

Fear feels uncomfortable.
But it points you forward.

Learning bridges the gap.
Growth is the outcome.

So if you‚Äôre feeling uneasy right now,
good.

You didn‚Äôt do something wrong.
You just left the comfort zone.

Stay there long enough to learn.
That‚Äôs how growth actually happens.

‚ÄúWhere Does the Soul Go After Death?‚Äù...

Death isn‚Äôt the end, it‚Äôs a change of worlds.
But not every soul enters the same place.

In the reel, the father speaks about the merciful side of the unseen world, the place of peace, safety, and divine comfort.
But Islam teaches something deeper:
souls separate into different destinations depending on the life they lived, the choices they made, and the state of their hearts.

For the righteous, the transition is gentle, like falling asleep in Allah‚Äôs mercy.
For others, the journey is different.
Death reflects who we became.

This conversation focuses on the beauty prepared for those who lived with faith, sincerity, and goodness.
But it‚Äôs also a reminder:
Every decision shapes where your soul wakes up next.

Live with intention.
Live with faith.
Because the soul always returns to the One who gave it.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz

i just hope we all find more peace than pressure in content creation, i‚Äôll be honest, no matter how hard we all try to not be drained, social media does its work and that‚Äôs exactly when we need a break. i am someone who does not find comfort in making trending reels on trending audios, but there are times i feel like that‚Äôs the only way to grow (it isn‚Äôt) it took me time to realise that i want my account to be that calm space without loud content and music, i want it to be something people can relax while watching and i am going to try my best to do that in 2026. ü§ç

Your Success Isn‚Äôt Late...
You Are Being Prepared

What feels like delay is often protection.

Allah doesn‚Äôt deny; He prepares.

Some doors open only when you‚Äôre strong enough to walk through them.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz

what products are you taking into 2026? 
I try my best to keep my skincare as minimal as i can. For the days I am home i use only quench and the lip pigmentation treatment, and switch quench with moisturiser some days. For the days when i go out, i use the moisturiser and sunscreen duo (it sits well under makeup too) 
Pro tip: if you have dry skin, use quench as a primer 
@organic_traveller is also having their ongoing sale rn which offers 25% off and a free mini product.

If Allah Already Knows‚Ä¶ Do Your Choices Still Matter?

If everything is written, why choose at all?
Because knowing a path isn‚Äôt the same as forcing it.

You didn‚Äôt choose where you started.
But every step after that is yours.

Fate sets the stage.
Free will writes the story.

And Allah doesn‚Äôt judge what you were given;
He judges what you chose to do with it.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz #freedom

The Self Is the Cage...

Freedom doesn‚Äôt come from finding yourself, it comes from losing the idea of who you think you are.

#inspirationalquote #inspirationalwords #openmind #amrouz

#amrouz #inspirationalquotes #lifelessons

This year, I went quiet.

Over the last 3 years i‚Äôve been traveling all over the world, from one event to another, from one stage to the next. But along the way, I realised something uncomfortable:
impact through events and social media is often anecdotal and shallow.

It looks powerful.
It feels productive.
But when the lights go off, very little actually remains.

So I decide to step away from everything...

I stopped traveling, doing tours, lectures and being in the public. And I finally chose to get my head down and poured myself into building something that wouldn‚Äôt disappear when the lights went off. 

In Ramadan 2025 there was just an idea, a vision and a sincere intention to make genuine, long lasting change. Many of you supported it before there was anything to show. 

And I can never express my true gratitude to all of you who believed in this. May Allah reward you all. 

Since then, structures have been built.
Teams have been formed.
Leaders have been gathered.
Systems have been put in place.

All for one reason:
to save the next generation from losing their faith. 

The foundations are now laid.
And the next phase is about scale.

2026 is all about solidifying everything. And then moving this vision forward. 
Supporting more leaders. 
Impacting more young people. 

And making sure this work never stops. 

If saving the next generations matters to you and if you want to help ensure it continues long after us‚Ä¶

Comment the word‚ÄúSAVE‚Äù to be part of this mission. 

Follow @criterion.group and stay with us as we take this forward.

The responsibility is now on our shoulders. 

Bismillah.

images.caption:
Everyone talks about the ‚Äúgrowth zone‚Äù.

Very few people tell you what actually sits between you and it.

Let us explain.

You don‚Äôt jump from comfort straight to growth.
That‚Äôs not how it works in real life.

The first stop is fear.

Fear of looking stupid.
Fear of getting it wrong.
Fear of wasting time.
Fear of being judged.

Most people feel that fear and turn back.
They call it ‚Äúbeing realistic‚Äù.
It‚Äôs not.
It‚Äôs staying comfortable.

Here‚Äôs the truth we‚Äôve seen over and over again at GrowRizq:

Growth doesn‚Äôt start with confidence.
It starts with learning.

Learning what works.
Learning what doesn‚Äôt.
Learning through repetition, mistakes, and feedback.

That learning phase feels slow.
Messy.
Uncertain.

And that‚Äôs exactly why it works.

Because every time you step through fear instead of avoiding it,
you earn clarity.
You earn skill.
You earn momentum.

Comfort feels safe.
But it doesn‚Äôt move you.

Fear feels uncomfortable.
But it points you forward.

Learning bridges the gap.
Growth is the outcome.

So if you‚Äôre feeling uneasy right now,
good.

You didn‚Äôt do something wrong.
You just left the comfort zone.

Stay there long enough to learn.
That‚Äôs how growth actually happens.

This is how people think goals work.

You set a goal.
You work hard.
You achieve it.

Clean. Straight. Simple.

That‚Äôs the expectation.

Now let us explain the reality.

You start.
Then you doubt yourself.
Then you try to learn.
Then you mess it up.
Then you practice.
Then you fail.
Then you feel lost.
Then you get a small win.
Then you struggle again.

And only then do you achieve it.

This part right here...
the confusion, the setbacks, the frustration...

That‚Äôs not failure.
That is the process.

At GrowRizq, we see people quit in the middle all the time.
Not because they‚Äôre incapable.
But because no one told them this part was normal.

They thought something was wrong.
It wasn‚Äôt.

Progress doesn‚Äôt move in a straight line.
It loops.
It doubles back.
It tests you.

And the people who make it
aren‚Äôt the most talented.
They‚Äôre the ones who don‚Äôt panic
when reality doesn‚Äôt match the picture in their head.

So if things feel messy right now‚Ä¶
If you‚Äôre doubting yourself‚Ä¶
If it‚Äôs taking longer than you expected‚Ä¶

Good.

You‚Äôre not off track.
You‚Äôre on it.

Stay in the game.
Keep moving.
The line only looks straight once you‚Äôre on the other side.
